permafrost.tundra.time

Class DateTimeHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • permafrost.tundra.time.DateTimeHelper

  • public class DateTimeHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of convenience methods for working with datetimes.

      static java.util.Calendar normalize(java.lang.Object object)
      Normalizes the given Object to a Calendar: if it's already a Calendar, it is returned; if it's a Date, it is converted to a Calendar; if it's a Number, it is treated as a milliseconds since epoch value to create a new Calendar; otherwise it is parsed as a datetime string.
      static java.util.Calendar normalize(java.lang.Object object, java.lang.String pattern)
      Normalizes the given Object to a Calendar: if it's already a Calendar, it is returned; if it's a Date, it is converted to a Calendar; if it's a Number, it is treated as a milliseconds since epoch value to create a new Calendar; otherwise it is parsed as a datetime string.
      static java.util.Calendar normalize(java.lang.Object object, java.lang.String pattern, java.lang.String timezone)
      Normalizes the given Object to a Calendar: if it's already a Calendar, it is returned; if it's a Date, it is converted to a Calendar; if it's a Number, it is treated as a milliseconds since epoch value to create a new Calendar; otherwise it is parsed as a datetime string.
      static java.util.Calendar normalize(java.lang.Object object, java.lang.String pattern, java.util.TimeZone timezone)
      Normalizes the given Object to a Calendar: if it's already a Calendar, it is returned; if it's a Date, it is converted to a Calendar; if it's a Number, it is treated as a milliseconds since epoch value to create a new Calendar; otherwise it is parsed as a datetime string.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.util.Calendar firstCalendar,
                          java.util.Calendar secondCalendar)
        Compares two datetimes.
        Parameters:
        firstCalendar - The first calendar to compare.
        secondCalendar - The second calendar to compare.
        Returns:
        Zero if both calendars represent that same instant in time, less than zero if the firstCalendar is an earlier instant in time than the secondCalendar, or greater than zero if the firstCalendar is greater than the secondCalendar.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.String firstDate,
                          java.lang.String firstPattern,
                          java.lang.String secondDate,
                          java.lang.String secondPattern)
        Compares two datetime strings.
        Parameters:
        firstDate - The first datetime string to compare.
        firstPattern - The datetime pattern firstDate conforms to.
        secondDate - The second datetime string to compare.
        secondPattern - The datetime pattern secondDate conforms to.
        Returns:
        Zero if both calendars represent that same instant in time, less than zero if the firstCalendar is an earlier instant in time than the secondCalendar, or greater than zero if the firstCalendar is greater than the secondCalendar.

        Parameters:
        startCalendar - The starting instant in time.
        endCalendar - The ending instant in time.
        Returns:

                                      java.util.TimeZone timezone)

                                             java.util.Calendar time)

        date - The date part to be concatenated.

        Returns:

      • normalize

        public static java.util.Calendar normalize(java.lang.Object object)
        Normalizes the given Object to a Calendar: if it's already a Calendar, it is returned; if it's a Date, it is converted to a Calendar; if it's a Number, it is treated as a milliseconds since epoch value to create a new Calendar; otherwise it is parsed as a datetime string.
        Parameters:
        object - The Object to be normalized to a Calendar.
        Returns:
        A Calendar object representing the given Object.

      • normalize

        public static java.util.Calendar normalize(java.lang.Object object,
                                           java.lang.String pattern)
        Normalizes the given Object to a Calendar: if it's already a Calendar, it is returned; if it's a Date, it is converted to a Calendar; if it's a Number, it is treated as a milliseconds since epoch value to create a new Calendar; otherwise it is parsed as a datetime string.
        Parameters:
        object - The Object to be normalized to a Calendar.
        pattern - An optional datetime pattern the given Object adheres to, if it's a String.
        Returns:
        A Calendar object representing the given Object.

      • normalize

        public static java.util.Calendar normalize(java.lang.Object object,
                                           java.lang.String pattern,
                                           java.lang.String timezone)
        Normalizes the given Object to a Calendar: if it's already a Calendar, it is returned; if it's a Date, it is converted to a Calendar; if it's a Number, it is treated as a milliseconds since epoch value to create a new Calendar; otherwise it is parsed as a datetime string.
        Parameters:
        object - The Object to be normalized to a Calendar.
        pattern - An optional datetime pattern the given Object adheres to, if it's a String.
        timezone - The time zone ID identifying the time zone which the parsed string will be forced.
        Returns:
        A Calendar object representing the given Object.

      • normalize

        public static java.util.Calendar normalize(java.lang.Object object,
                                           java.lang.String pattern,
                                           java.util.TimeZone timezone)
        Normalizes the given Object to a Calendar: if it's already a Calendar, it is returned; if it's a Date, it is converted to a Calendar; if it's a Number, it is treated as a milliseconds since epoch value to create a new Calendar; otherwise it is parsed as a datetime string.
        Parameters:
        object - The Object to be normalized to a Calendar.
        pattern - An optional datetime pattern the given Object adheres to, if it's a String.
        timezone - The time zone into which the parsed string will be forced.
        Returns:
        A Calendar object representing the given Object.
